com.microsoft.azure.management.datalake.store.uploader

Class UploadMetadata

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.azure.management.datalake.store.uploader.UploadMetadata
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class UploadMetadata
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Represents general metadata pertaining to an upload.
    See Also:

      • UploadMetadata

        public UploadMetadata(String metadataFilePath,
                      UploadParameters uploadParameters)
        Constructs a new UploadMetadata from the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        metadataFilePath - The file path to assign to this metadata file (for saving purposes).
        uploadParameters - The parameters to use for constructing this metadata.

        Initializes a new instance of the UploadMetadata class for use with unit testing.

    • Method Detail

      • getUploadId

        public String getUploadId()
        Returns:
        A value indicating the unique identifier associated with this upload.

      • getInputFilePath

        public String getInputFilePath()
        Returns:
        A value indicating the full path to the file to be uploaded.

      • getFileLength

        public long getFileLength()
        Returns:
        A value indicating the length (in bytes) of the file to be uploaded.

      • getTargetStreamPath

        public String getTargetStreamPath()
        Returns:
        A value indicating the full stream path where the file will be uploaded to.

      • getSegmentStreamDirectory

        public String getSegmentStreamDirectory()
        Returns:
        A value indicating the directory path where intermediate segment streams will be stored.

      • getSegmentCount

        public int getSegmentCount()
        Returns:
        A value indicating the number of segments this file is split into for purposes of uploading it.

      • setSegmentCount

        public void setSegmentCount(int segCount)
        Parameters:
        segCount - Sets the segment count to the specified count.

      • getSegmentLength

        public long getSegmentLength()
        Returns:
        A value indicating the length (in bytes) of each segment of the file (except the last one, which may be less).

      • setSegmentLength

        public void setSegmentLength(long segLength)
        Parameters:
        segLength - The length to set the segment length to.

      • getSegments

        public UploadSegmentMetadata[] getSegments()
        Returns:
        A pointer to an array of segment metadata. The segments are ordered by their segment number (sequence).

      • setSegments

        public void setSegments(UploadSegmentMetadata[] segs)
        Parameters:
        segs - The value to set the segment array to.

      • isBinary

        public boolean isBinary()
        Returns:
        A value indicating whether the upload file should be treated as a binary file or not.

      • getEncodingName

        public String getEncodingName()
        Returns:
        The name of the current encoding being used.

      • getDelimiter

        public String getDelimiter()
        Returns:
        A value indicating the record boundary delimiter for the file, if any.

      • getMetadataFilePath

        public String getMetadataFilePath()
        Returns:
        A value indicating the path where this metadata file is located.

      • loadFrom

        public static UploadMetadata loadFrom(String filePath)
                               throws FileNotFoundException,
                                      InvalidMetadataException
        Attempts to load an UploadMetadata object from the given file.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The full path to the file where to load the metadata from
        Returns:
        A deserialized UploadMetadata object from the file specified.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - Thrown if the filePath is inaccessible or does not exist
        InvalidMetadataException - Thrown if the metadata is not in the expected format.

      • save

        public void save()
          throws IOException,
                 InvalidMetadataException
        Saves the given metadata to its canonical location. This method is thread-safe.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the file cannot be saved due to accessibility or there is an error saving the stream to disk.
        InvalidMetadataException - Thrown if the metadata is invalid.

      • deleteFile

        public void deleteFile()
                throws InvalidObjectException
        Deletes the metadata file from disk.
        Throws:
        InvalidObjectException - Thrown if the metadata file path has not yet been set.

      • validateConsistency

        public void validateConsistency()
                         throws InvalidMetadataException
        Verifies the given metadata for consistency. Checks include: Completeness Existence and consistency with local file Segment data consistency
        Throws:
        InvalidMetadataException - Thrown if the metadata is invalid.

      • splitTargetStreamPathByName

        public String[] splitTargetStreamPathByName()
        Splits the target stream path, returning the name of the stream and storing the full directory path (if any) in an out variable.
        Returns:
        A string array with the stream name is at index 0 and the stream path (if any) at index 1.
